fields.title: What is a package.yaml?
fields.content:
The package.yaml file is used to give the extension maintainer the chance to add more meaningful information about their extension than we can crawl from GitHub: 
name: My awesome extension
description: A short introduction to whatever my awesome extension does
type: lovelace
keywords:
  - awesome
  - terrific
  - gigantic
author:
  name: John Doe
  email: john@doe.com
  homepage: https://john.doe.com
license: MIT
dependencies:
  - thomasloven/lovelace-card-tools
files:
  - awesome-gigantic-card.js
name
Give your extension a meaningful name.
GitHub username and repository name used as fallback.
description
Describe the use of your extension in a few simple words. GitHub project description used as fallback.
type
Can be either "lovelace" or "component". If not provided, the index will guess by the count of .js and .py files found in the repository.
keywords
Add some keywords to be found in the search results.
author -> name
What will you be called? GitHub username used as fallback.
author -> email
How can your users contact you?
author -> homepage
Feel free to use this as a self-marketing opportunity.
license
Please provide a license name so your users can feel safe.
Free and open licenses like MIT and Apache preferred :-)
dependencies
If your extension requires another extension (like card-tools) to work, list them by their GitHub handle, e.g. "thomasloven/lovelace-card-tools".
We will then index and link the requirement.
files
This is a special one. It's not directly needed to build the index but for what might come next.
List all files that must be installed with Home Assistant for your extension to work.

Thanks for supporting the index! You're awesome!
